chinese: walk or travel, usu. for a long time, with no clear purpose or direction 闲逛；漫步；漫步于
examples: e.g. Tigers once [[roamed]] far and wide across much of Southeast Asia.

chinese: having or showing strong feelings of love or of anger, etc. 感情强烈的；热情的
examples: e.g. Sarah was greeted with a [[passionate]] embrace by her husband and children at Heathrow Airport on returning to London.

chinese: [sing.] the edge of the land that is next to the water in a port 码头边；坞边
examples: e.g. The [[dockside]] was the busiest place he had ever seen.

chinese: 1) [C, U] the act of people coming together after they have been apart for some time 团圆；重逢
examples: e.g. It was a very emotional [[reunion]], for the children weren't allowed to see her for nearly a week.；e.g. We all look forward to our class [[reunion]], an awesome celebration with old friends!

chinese: 2) [C] a social occasion or party attended by a group of people who have not seen each other for a long time 聚会
examples: e.g. It was a very emotional [[reunion]], for the children weren't allowed to see her for nearly a week.；e.g. We all look forward to our class [[reunion]], an awesome celebration with old friends!

chinese: serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of sb.'s behavior 严厉的；严格的；苛刻的
examples: e.g. The manager gave a [[stern]] warning to those who were on strike.

chinese: 1) marked by worry and distress; troublesome 令人烦恼的
examples: e.g. Mr. Royama and others are likely to find the coming week a very [[fretful]] one indeed.；e.g. The boy appeared [[fretful]] and disappointed that he couldn't join the others on their trip.

chinese: 2) anxious and complaining, and unable to relax 烦恼的；发牢骚的
examples: e.g. Mr. Royama and others are likely to find the coming week a very [[fretful]] one indeed.；e.g. The boy appeared [[fretful]] and disappointed that he couldn't join the others on their trip.

chinese: [C] sb. who has been forced to leave their country, esp. during a war, or for political or religious reasons 难民；避难者
examples: e.g. The [[refugees]] were packed shoulder to shoulder on the boat.

chinese: having or supplied with too much of sth. 超载的；超负荷的
examples: e.g. Even a simple turn becomes risky when the truck is [[overloaded]].

chinese: 1) a small boat carried by ships in order to save people if the ship sinks （船上备用的）救生艇
examples: e.g. The captain ordered all passengers into [[lifeboats]].；e.g. Sam's dog was saved by a [[lifeboat]] during the incident on Tuesday afternoon.

chinese: 2) a boat that is sent out to help people who are in danger at sea （海上）救生艇（船）
examples: e.g. The captain ordered all passengers into [[lifeboats]].；e.g. Sam's dog was saved by a [[lifeboat]] during the incident on Tuesday afternoon.

chinese: 1) single; unique 单个的；独一无二的
examples: e.g. She always thought of herself as [[singular]], as her father's only daughter.；e.g. Can you tell me the [[singular]] form of this noun?

chinese: 2) of or relating to the form of a word used when referring to one person or thing （词形）单数的
examples: e.g. She always thought of herself as [[singular]], as her father's only daughter.；e.g. Can you tell me the [[singular]] form of this noun?

chinese: [C] 双层公共汽车
[C] 风车；风车磨坊
[C] (BrE pavement) 人行道
[sing.] your ability to understand a complicated idea, situation, or subject （对复杂想法、情况或问题的）理解力，领悟力
examples: e.g. Steve has a good [[grasp]] of the European legal system.；e.g. I [[grasped]] his arm firmly and led him away.

chinese: take and hold sth. firmly 抓牢；握紧
examples: e.g. Steve has a good [[grasp]] of the European legal system.；e.g. I [[grasped]] his arm firmly and led him away.

chinese: (also ~ up) (AmE line, line up) form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do sth. or go somewhere 排队（等候）
examples: e.g. People are [[queuing]] to get in from 7 a.m.；e.g. All of a sudden a woman elbowed her way to the front of the [[queue]].

chinese: [C] (AmE line) a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy sth., etc. or a line of vehicles waiting to move （人或车辆为等候而排的）队，行列
examples: e.g. People are [[queuing]] to get in from 7 a.m.；e.g. All of a sudden a woman elbowed her way to the front of the [[queue]].

chinese: to or at any place, position, or situation 无论去哪里；无论在哪里；无论什么情况下
examples: e.g. [[Wherever]] you choose to live, there are always going to be advantages and disadvantages.

chinese: arranged or organized in a sensible or neat way 有条理的；整齐的
examples: e.g. She put all the letters received in the last two years in three [[orderly]] piles.

chinese: 1) struggle or compete with other people to get or reach sth. 争夺；抢夺
examples: e.g. Thousands of people will be [[scrambling]] for tickets.；e.g. She [[scrambled]] down the tree quickly.

chinese: 2) (always + ad. / prep.) climb up, down, or over sth. quickly and with difficulty, esp. using your hands to help you （迅速而吃力地）爬，攀登
examples: e.g. Thousands of people will be [[scrambling]] for tickets.；e.g. She [[scrambled]] down the tree quickly.

chinese: on or onto a ship, plane, or train 在船（飞机、火车）上；上船（飞机、火车）
examples: e.g. Given the early hour, the train was not crowded at all, with only about 30 passengers [[aboard]].；e.g. After all the troubles, they finally went [[aboard]] the plane.

chinese: on or onto a ship, plane, or train 在（船、飞机、火车）上；上（船、飞机、火车）
examples: e.g. Given the early hour, the train was not crowded at all, with only about 30 passengers [[aboard]].；e.g. After all the troubles, they finally went [[aboard]] the plane.

chinese: with the top at the bottom and the bottom at the top 倒置地；颠倒地
examples: e.g. To get the plant out of the pot, turn it [[upside down]] and give it a gentle knock.

chinese: [C, U] a sudden strong desire to do sth. without thinking about whether it is a sensible thing to do 冲动；突然的欲望
examples: e.g. Mary felt a sudden [[impulse]] to play some music.

chinese: (cause to) move up or away after hitting a surface （使）弹起；（使）反弹；（使）弹跳
examples: e.g. The ball [[bounced]] twice before he could reach it.

chinese: [U] (AmE humor) the ability to find things funny, the way in which people see that some things are funny, or the quality of being funny 幽默感；幽默
examples: e.g. Even a speech on a serious subject could be delivered with a little [[humour]].

chinese: (the ~) [pl.] 瑞士人
(the ~) [pl.] 西班牙人
1) (fml.) cause a particular feeling or reaction 引起；激起
examples: e.g. This product has [[excited]] a great deal of media interest.；e.g. His playing is technically brilliant, but it doesn't [[excite]] me.

chinese: 2) (not in progressive) make sb. feel happy, interested, or eager 使兴奋；使激动
examples: e.g. This product has [[excited]] a great deal of media interest.；e.g. His playing is technically brilliant, but it doesn't [[excite]] me.

chinese: having qualities that are typical of a child 孩子般的；像孩子似的；天真无邪的
examples: e.g. All her life she had a [[childlike]] trust in other people.

chinese: not knowing information or facts that you ought to know 无知的；愚昧的
examples: e.g. They remained [[ignorant]] of the troubles that lay ahead.

chinese: in a way that can be trusted or believed 可靠地；可信赖地
examples: e.g. The website helps you find what you want faster and more [[reliably]].

chinese: put sb. / sth. in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed 使处于险境；危及
examples: e.g. We must be careful not to do anything that might [[endanger]] the economic recovery.

chinese: 1) [C, usu. sing.] a particular way of life 生活；生活方式
examples: e.g. Surfing the Internet has become part of our everyday [[existence]].；e.g. The organization has been in [[existence]] for 25 years.

chinese: 2) [U] the state of existing 存在；实有
examples: e.g. Surfing the Internet has become part of our everyday [[existence]].；e.g. The organization has been in [[existence]] for 25 years.

chinese: [C] 打扫房间的女工；（尤指宾馆里的）客房女服务员
[C] (BrE) a small paper or cardboard container in which goods are packed for selling （装商品的）小包，小袋，小盒
examples: e.g. Could you please kindly bring me a few [[packets]] of biscuits?

chinese: smell sth. by taking air in through your nose 嗅；闻
examples: e.g. She put perfume on her wrist and [[sniffed]] it.；e.g. We all had colds and couldn't stop [[sniffing]] and sneezing.

chinese: breathe air into your nose noisily, for example when you are crying or have a cold （因哭泣、感冒等）抽鼻子
examples: e.g. She put perfume on her wrist and [[sniffed]] it.；e.g. We all had colds and couldn't stop [[sniffing]] and sneezing.

chinese: confuse sb. or make them feel slightly anxious because they do not understand sth. 使困惑；使迷惑
examples: e.g. The findings of the survey [[puzzled]] me — they were not at all what I would have expected.

chinese: [C] 拼图游戏；拼图玩具
examples: e.g. The findings of the survey [[puzzled]] me — they were not at all what I would have expected.

chinese: please and interest sb. 吸引···的兴趣；迷住
examples: e.g. The story has [[charmed]] generations of children.；e.g. Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the 1937 Disney classic, has lost none of its original [[charm]].

chinese: [C, U] a quality that makes you like or feel attracted to sb. / sth. 魅力；吸引力
examples: e.g. The story has [[charmed]] generations of children.；e.g. Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs, the 1937 Disney classic, has lost none of its original [[charm]].

chinese: used to emphasize that sb. / sth. does not have a particular quality or would not do sth. 根本不···；完全不···
examples: e.g. He's no more fit to be the group leader than I am.

chinese: (BrE get round) if news or information gets around, it is told to a lot of people （新闻或消息）传开
examples: e.g. Word [[got around]] that the shopping mall might be closed.

chinese: for example 例如
examples: e.g. We found out that fruit loaf (水果面包) is better than cake or chocolate, for instance.

chinese: (infml.) understand the technique of doing sth. 掌握···的窍门
examples: e.g. It's not difficult once you get the hang of it.

chinese: when a vehicle or driver pulls up, the vehicle slows down and stops （车辆或司机）停车
examples: e.g. The taxi [[pulled up]] and the driver jumped out.

english: as far as sb. is concerned
chinese: (spoken) used to show what sb.'s opinion on a subject is or how it affects them 在某人看来；就某人而言
examples: e.g. As far as I am concerned, a change of policy is needed to reduce the unemployment rate.

chinese: wash sth. quickly, esp. the inside of a container 洗净（尤指容器内壁）
examples: e.g. When the bottle is empty, [[wash it out]] thoroughly before refilling.

chinese: after a period of time, or after everything has been done 最后；终于
examples: e.g. As long as you try hard, you'll surely succeed in the end.

chinese: 哥本哈根（丹麦首都）
丹麦（欧洲国家）
荷兰（欧洲国家）
奥斯陆（挪威首都）
